com.ibm.team.scm.client
Interface IWorkspaceConnection.IConfigurationOpFactory

Enclosing interface:
IWorkspaceConnection
public static interface IWorkspaceConnection.IConfigurationOpFactory

Factory for creating operations that modify the configuration of a workspace.

See Also:
#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection)

Method Summary

Method Detail

save

IWorkspaceConnection.ISaveOp save(IVersionable item)
Returns a operation object for placing a versionable item in the workspace's configuration in the given state. The item need not be present in the configuration beforehand. The given versionable can either be a newly-created versionable item; the versionable is its initial state; or it can be an working copy (@see IItem.getWorkingCopy() of an existing versionable; the versionable is a working copy of a previously-retrieved state that the client has modified to suit. In both case, a new versionable state is created in the repository.

Parameters:
item - the versionable item; must be a working copy, must not be null
Returns:
an opaque configuration operation token that can be passed to commit; never null

merge

IWorkspaceConnection.IMergeOp merge(IWorkspaceConnection.IMergeResultOp nestedOp,
                                    IVersionableHandle selectedContributorState,
                                    IVersionableHandle proposedContributorState)
Returns an operation object representing the desire to resolve a conflict through the action as indicated by a supplied configuration operation object. It is considered an error (at the time of commit()) if the item is not considered to be in conflict in the workspace. The supplied configuration operation is applied as normally through IWorkspaceConnection.commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection, IProgressMonitor).

If the supplied contributors (selected & proposed) do not align with what is in the conflict record for that item, the call to commit() will fail.

Parameters:
nestedOp - an operation which serves as the merge result for a conflict; cannot be null.
selectedContributorState - an item-state handle which describes the selected contributor to the conflict, can be null to indicate a deletion.
proposedContributorState - an item-state handle which describes the proposed contributor to the conflict, can be null to indicate a deletion.
Returns:
an opaque configuration operation token that can be passed to commit; never null
See Also:
IWorkspaceConnection.conflictReport(), IItemConflictReport.getProposedContributorState(), IItemConflictReport.getSelectedContributorState()

markAsMerged

IWorkspaceConnection.IMarkAsMergedOp markAsMerged(IVersionableHandle item,
                                                  IVersionableHandle selectedContributorState,
                                                  IVersionableHandle proposedContributorState)
Returns an operation object representing the desire to resolve a conflict with the state which currently exists in the configuration. It is considered an error (at the time of commit()) if the item is not considered to be in conflict in the workspace.

It is also considered an error (at the time of commit()) to perform this operation on an item whose state selection refers to a state that is not a successor to the originally selected state for the conflict.

The intended use of this operation is as follows:
  • to allow for a client to break the save/resolve operation as described in #save(IVersionable,IVersionableHandle,IVersionableHandle) into two distinct (but equivalent) steps
  • to allow for the deleted state to resolve a conflict.

Parameters:
item - the versionable item handle; the state id, if present, is ignored; must not be null
selectedContributorState - an item-state handle which describes the selected contributor to the conflict, can be null to indicate a deletion.
proposedContributorState - an item-state handle which describes the proposed contributor to the conflict, can be null to indicate a deletion.
Returns:
an opaque configuration operation token that can be passed to commit; never null
See Also:
IWorkspaceConnection.conflictReport()

revert

IWorkspaceConnection.IRevertOp revert(IVersionableHandle itemStateHandle)
Returns a operation object for placing a versionable item in the workspace's configuration in a pre-existing state whose state id is included with the handle. No versionable states are created in the repository. The item need not be present in the configuration beforehand. It is considered an error (detected at commit time) if the given item state is not present in the repository.

Parameters:
itemStateHandle - the versionable item handle with state id; must not be null
Returns:
an opaque configuration operation token that can be passed to commit; never null

delete

IWorkspaceConnection.IDeleteOp delete(IVersionableHandle itemHandle)
Returns a operation object for deleting a versionable item from the workspace's configuration. It is considered an error (detected at commit time) if the given item is not present in the configuration at the time.

Note that one of these operations cannot be commited alone. It is always necessary to simultaneously commit a modification to (or deletion of) the folder that contains the given item.

Parameters:
itemHandle - the versionable item handle; the state id, if present, is ignored; must not be null
Returns:
an opaque configuration operation token that can be passed to commit; never null

deleteSubtree

IWorkspaceConnection.IDeleteSubtreeOp deleteSubtree(IFolderHandle folderHandle)
Returns an operation object for deleting a subtree of versionable items rooted at the specified folder from the workspace's configuration. The folder needs to be present in the configuration beforehand.

If the folder has descendants in the configuration at commit time, this operation "macro expands" to a set of individual IWorkspaceConnection.IConfigurationOpFactory.delete(IVersionableHandle) operations for each of the items in the subtree, including the folder itself. It is considered an error (detected at commit time) if after macro expanding a single call to commit has multiple operations that mention the same item.

Parameters:
folderHandle - the versionable folder item handle; the state id, if present, is ignored; must not be null
Returns:
an opaque configuration operation token that can be passed to commit; never null

undo

IWorkspaceConnection.IUndoOp undo(IVersionableHandle itemHandle)
Returns a operation object for removing changes for the given item from an active change set. This item will be removed from the list of items affected by this particular change set. It is considered an error (detected at commit time) if the item is not affected by any active change set.

Parameters:
itemHandle - the versionable item handle; the state id, if present, is ignored; must not be null
Returns:
an opaque configuration operation token that can be passed to commit; never null
